citation.article-title: Acetoanaerobium notera gen. nov., sp. nov.: an anaerobic bacterium that forms acetate from H2 and CO2

p.s: Acetoanaerobium (A.ce.to.an.ae.ro'bi.um. L. n. acetum vinegar; Gr. pref. an not; Gr. n. aer air; Gr. n. bios life; M. L. neut. n. Acetoanaerobium vinegar anaerobe)
Cells stain gram negative but have an atypical gram-negative wall structure.
Ferment carbohydrates, producing acetate and sometimes other volatile acids.
Ferment yeast extract, producing acetate and several volatile acids.
At slower growth rates produce acetate from H2 and CO2; may require yeast extract for growth.
The type species is Acetoanaerobium noterae.
